page.title: 12RELIGION, NORTH CREAKE
page.content: The Church of England's St Mary's Church is the only one to survive, in the village. Roman Catholic and Methodist services are held in Burnham Market. The Rectorial living of N Creake was the richest in the Diocese of Norwich, before all benifices were re-allocated. The Church of England has been compelled by shortage of clergymen to return to the system of plurality that was once such a scandal; requiring one priest to have several parishes in his care. The N Creake Rector is Priest-in-Charge of six. As well as the difficulties of travel during Norfolk winters, he copes with the variations in the order of service that are expected from one church to the next. The oldest church, St Michael's on the Mount, was closed at the Dissolution; very little remains.
